results.title: Champions of Sport No.2
results.creator_credit: Grand National Pictures and John Betts
results.brief_description: This film features three sports: the discuss thrower, the rower and the long jumper. The sports people focussed on are N. Syllas (Greece), K. Carpenter (USA), Ted Phelps and K.S. Duncan.

results.title: Champions of Sport No.1
results.creator_credit: Grand National Pictures and John Betts
results.brief_description: This short film discusses the technique, history and famous sports-people of the 1940s, focusing on hurlding, golf and high jumping. The athletes spotlighted are D.O. Finlay (hurdler), Pam Barton (golfer) and C.C. Johnson (high jumper)

results.title: Champions in the sun
results.creator_credit: Riddell Black, Films of Scotland and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: Describes the Royal Highland Show at Ingliston near Edinburgh. Cattle and sheep are judged by experts, and sequences describe the background of some of the pedigree animals, explaining the features which are expected in stock of this quality. Also includes show, crafts and bands. Narrated by Douglas Murchie.

results.title: Chamberlain at Munich, September 29, 1938
results.creator_credit: James Fonda, Young America Films, Columbia Broadcasting System and Bernard Girard
results.brief_description: One of the “You are there” television series. This docu-drama takes its audience back to September 29th, 1938. It deals with the efforts of Britain’s Prime Minister, Neville Chamberlain, to preserve peace with Germany, and Adolf Hitler’s empty promise made in the Munich Pact. Captures the tension and fear which hung over Europe as Daladier and Chamberlain yielded to Hitler’s demands and signed the Munich Pact. Contains archival footage and a cast including Roland Varno, Noel Drayton, Mike McHale, Robert Burton and Stephen Bekassy. “All events reported and seen are based on historic fact and quotation.” Narrated by Walter Cronkite.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Fonda, Young America Films, Columbia Broadcasting System and Bernard Girard

results.title: Challenges and rebirth
results.creator_credit: Kwang Hwa Mass Communications, Weng Jeng-Yih, Jao Ming and Lin Yung
results.brief_description: Documents the achievements of the Taiwanese people since the establishment of the Republic of China in 1949. The transition was difficult, but through hard work and dedication, Taiwan made its mark on the world marketplace. In the 21st Century, the Taiwanese are dedicated to further developing their “laissez-faire’ economy and democratic reforms.

results.title: Challenger: an industrial romance
results.brief_description: Challenger: An Industrial Romance follows the development of Canadair’s super-executive jet. A totally new type of aircraft, it is faster, cheaper to fly, and more comfortable than any other business jet. Would it make it off the drawing board and into the air? The film captures the spirit of the Canadian air transport industry and its attempt to compete with the American leaders in the industry. (Awards: San Francisco; Elmhurst; Toronto; Columbus; Budapest; New York)
